nodes.text: The Enaleh system was located in the Southern Core portion of the Colonies. It contained the terrestrial planet Enaleh. Enaleh was the homeworld of the hela, a species of serpentine amphibians that used a biologically generated repulsorlift field to float through Enaleh's atmosphere. Occasionally, helas were exported offworld; however, the creatures were a rare sight on other planets overall.

The Enaleh system fell within the borders of the Galactic Republic during the Pius Dea Era, a period of time that lasted between 12,000 BBY and 11,000 BBY. During that era, Enaleh served as an Ordnance/Regional Depot outpost for the Republic and was known as Ord Enaleh.

The Enaleh system was introduced via an illustration of Enaleh in the 1994 sourcebook Creatures of the Galaxy, published by West End Games for Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game. The section of the book describing the planet was authored by Chuck Truett and illustrated by David Plunkett. The 2009 reference book The Essential Atlas first identified the Enaleh system and placed it in grid square L-13.
